main event: A school crossing guard in Livonia, Michigan observed a bright, metallic, round, flat object hovering over a school building on February 9, 1967.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for approximately 2 minutes before rapidly accelerating and disappearing from view.
The witness, Richard J. Livingston, reported the incident to the Livonia Police Department.
The Air Force's Foreign Technology Division was unable to evaluate the sighting due to insufficient data.
The case file includes 4 black and white photographs and 3 negatives, but the quality of the images is poor and does not clearly show the details of the object.
The case is classified as 'unidentified' due to the lack of conclusive evidence.
sighted object: a bright, metallic, round, flat object
witnesses: Richard J. Livingston, school crossing guard
